title: Ticket #2891: add classad functions to split user names and slot names
description:
In order to more easily add statistics collections based on expressions evaluated against the job ad. It would be nice to have a easy to seprate out the username part of a fully qualified username, or the machine part of a slot name.

Classads should have functions to do this.

splitslotname(Name) where Name is "slot@machine" will return a list containing {"slot", "machine"}.

splitusername(Name) where Name is "user@domain" will return a list containing {"user", "domain}

Thus the expression splitslotname(Name)[1] will evaluate to "machine" and the expression splitusername(Name)[0] will evaluate to "user".

When the input string for these functions has no @, the result will still be a list of 2 strings, but in that case they behave differently.

splitslotname("string") will return {"","string"}.

splitusername("string") will return {"string",""}.
